answerText: "Verses Upon the Burning of our House, July 18th, 1666"[10] Verses Upon the Burning of our House" was written by this "Tenth Muse" who sprang up in America.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 6 | 11 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The author reflects, "Here stood that Trunk, and there that chest, before declaring, "Adieu, Adieu, All's Vanity." For ten points each: [10] Name this poem that begins with screams in the night and concludes with the line, "My hope and treasure lie above."
